page.title: 11THE HUNDRED HOUSE
page.content: The present building dates back to the 18th century when it was built by Lord Foley to cater for the many visitors to the village with the expansion of Witley Court. It stands at the junction of roads to Worcester,Tenbury Droitwich,Bromyard,Stourport and Kidderminster and so was a busy staging post. The hotel today is not residential. There is a large restaurant which is open every evening and bar snacks are available in the lounge at lunchtime.Summer barbecues are held weather permitting. Regular entertainments are a Jazz evening, a Hawaiian evening and a Country and Western evening.The Farm Machinery Society and the Shooting Club meet there at regular intervals. The dining room has been recently extended and there are plans for further extensions to the restaurant.
